Page Edits.text: Your Journal, along with the other ACM Journals, is represented on the ACM Journals section landing page, , available in a block or list view.
The “Edit Page”, “Pending Edits” and “Scheduled” items allow you to modify existing content, preview and publish (or reject) changes, with the option of setting a schedule for publication.
This is the content you will be managing, and adding to with new pages, as needed.
We’ll edit the page “Information and guidelines for reviewers” – navigate to the page from the sub-menu and click on “Edit Page”:
The Periodical Menu Widget manages the Journal navigation.
You can make changes to the contents using the visual editor.
The page now renders with your change and provides a menu for publishing or rejecting the pending edits.
Choose “Edit” to continue modifying the page content.
Click on the “a” tab, expose the PB Menu, and click on “Edit page”.
Clicking on “Journals” from anywhere in the DL resolves to the page .
The ACM DL site-wide navigation includes a link to the ACM Journals section:
Your role of Page Builder Editor allows you to modify your Journal navigation, and the pages that follow will show you how.
Expand the Page Builder edit menu (“A” tab at right) and click on “Edit Page”.
Hover over the page and look for the “Periodical Menu Widget”.
Click on “Pending Edits”, then check the box to “Show pending edits on the page when there are any”.

New pages.text: Appendix 2 ACM Journal Editorial Board Pages
Creating a New Page
Editing a Page
Welcome to the new ACM Digital Library, and to the pages of your Journal within the DL.
Your Journal, along with the other ACM Journals, is represented on the ACM Journals section landing page, , available in a block or list view.
The static pages are managed by Page Builder, a visual editor with content widgets.
This is the content you will be managing, and adding to with new pages, as needed.
We’ll edit the page “Information and guidelines for reviewers” – navigate to the page from the sub-menu and click on “Edit Page”:
The Periodical Menu Widget manages the Journal navigation.
Note: “new-page” is just an example, you should name your new page exactly as you’d like it to be known.

Unlike the standard static pages, these pages use a “Generic Widget” that reads a JSON file to display the information for each Editorial Board.

Question 1.question: How do I add a new page?
Question 1.statement: To add a new page, you need to be logged in and past the 2FA step in edit mode, then click on "Create Page." You should name your new page exactly as you'd like it to be known. If the page doesn't exist yet, the system will prompt you to create it with a "Page not found" form that includes fields for the page template, which defines the group of pages and page template to use for your new page. Once the new page is created, you can manage its content and add new pages as needed.

Question 2.question: Can the navigation menu be edited?
Question 2.statement: Yes, the navigation menu can be edited. You can add new menu items by scrolling down to find the item you want to edit or remove or add a new navigation item. To add a new item to the navigation “top” level, scroll all the way to the bottom of the Periodical Menu Widget window and click on “Add Menu Item”. By default, new menu items will be at the bottom of the entire navigation, but you can drag-and-drop to re-order the menu and sub-menu items. You can also add a new sub-menu item. Once you add a new menu item, it will appear in the editing window. There are examples of sub-menu navigation, and the Administration Menu: Page Builder is available for editing the navigation.

Question 3.question: How are changes published?
Question 3.statement: To publish changes, click "Publish" after making the desired modifications. The page now renders with your changes and provides a menu with the option to publish or reject pending edits. Alternatively, you can set a schedule for publication, review the page with the changes using "Review," and then click "Publish." If you opt for "Decline," the changes are rolled back and will not be saved. To discard the changes, click "Discard Changes" and confirm the action. If an editorial board change is needed, contact Stacey Schick. ACM Journals Manager Laura Lander should be contacted for other updates.

annotations.text: This information is maintained by the ACM Publications Department, and requests for changes should be directed to ACM Journals Manager Laura Lander, .
The “Edit Page”, “Pending Edits” and “Scheduled” items allow you to modify existing content, preview and publish (or reject) changes, with the option of setting a schedule for publication.
The page now renders with your change and provides a menu for publishing or rejecting the pending edits.
If you click “Publish”, you can opt to add a comment, and your changes will be public.
You can “Decline” the changes, which will roll them back (won’t save).
“Publish” or “Decline”, accordingly (see ).
Your role of Page Builder Editor allows you to modify your Journal navigation, and the pages that follow will show you how.
If you discard your changes, you will be asked to confirm your action – click “Continue” if you are certain.
Click “Review” to see the page with your changes.
Click on “Pending Edits”, then check the box to “Show pending edits on the page when there are any”.
For changes to your Editorial Board, please contact Stacey Schick and provide her with the information we’ll need for a good presentation.
